content.definition: An endovascular technique for treating aortoiliac occlusive disease involving simultaneous deployment of stents in both common iliac arteries with the proximal ends positioned side-by-side ('kissing') in the distal aorta. This technique maintains flow to both limbs and prevents plaque shifting.
indications: Unilateral iliac stenting with contralateral disease
Protection of contralateral iliac during unilateral intervention

stent_positioning: Position proximal ends at same level
Stents should extend 5-10 mm into aorta
deployment: Simultaneous inflation of both balloon-expandable stents
post_dilation: Kissing balloon angioplasty after stent deployment

considerations.aortic_diameter: Minimum 14-16 mm aortic diameter for double-barrel
considerations.stent_sizing: Each stent should be sized to ipsilateral iliac, not half the aorta
considerations.landing_zone: Healthy aorta above disease for landing

clinical_pearls: Stents should extend 5-10 mm into aorta for 'kissing' overlap
ALWAYS do simultaneous final kissing balloon inflation
Size each stent to its iliac artery, not half the aorta
Protects contralateral iliac from plaque shift
